Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-05-10T19:00:01Describing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Gina Tlamsa Papers
Tlamsa, Gina
AIA.037
6.1 Linear Feet in 3 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, 1 record carton, and three oversize flat boxes
6 Reels
1 videocassettes (vhs)
7 audiocassettes
1966-1997 1980-1986 Gina Tlamsa is an American musician and radio host. Between 1981 and 1986 she hosted and produced The Shamrock Shore, a weekly two-hour live radio program on Columbia University's WKCR. The Gina Tlamsa Papers document Tlamsa's interest in Irish and Irish-American political activity in the 1980s and include ephemera, periodicals, letters, and audiovisual material. The collection dates between 1966 and 1997, with the bulk of the material between 1980 and 1986. Topics include Irish Republican issues, in particular hunger strikes in Northern Ireland, human rights issues in Northern Ireland, political prisoners in Northern Ireland and the United States. Materials primarily in English, with some materials in Irish. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Gina Tlamsa in December 2002 and May 2003. The accession number associated with this collection is 1997.029.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical Note
Gina Tlamsa is an American musician and radio host. Between 1981 and 1986 she hosted and produced The Shamrock Shore, a weekly two-hour live radio program on Columbia University's WKCR. The program included traditional Irish music, announcements of local Irish community events, Irish news, and interviews.
Scope and Contents
The Gina Tlamsa Papers document Tlamsa's interest in Irish and Irish-American political activity in the 1980s and include ephemera, periodicals, government publications, letters, and audiovisual material. The collection dates between 1966 and 1997, with the bulk of the material between 1980 and 1986. Topics include Irish Republican issues, in particular hunger strikes in Northern Ireland, human rights issues in Northern Ireland, and political prisoners in Northern Ireland and the United States, in particular Joe Doherty. Ephemera includes flyers, newsletters, bumper stickers, and posters from Irish and Irish-American organizations, including New York H-Block/Armagh Committee, American Irish Unity Committee, American Irish Heritage Foundation, Irish-American Defense Fund, Northern Ireland Civil Rights Association, Irish Northern Aid-IPOW Hunger Strike Defense Fund, and Sinn Fein. Periodicals include Éire-Ireland, Guth An Phobial, Saoirse na h-Éireann, The Spirit of Freedom, The Irish American Voice, Irish Echo, and The Irish People. Government publications include two reports on hearings in the United States Senate, the first on the United States and United Kingdom Supplementary Extradition Treaty in 1985 and the second on Issues Relating to the Deportation of Michael O'Rourke in 1984. Audiovisual material includes audio recordings of three 1983 episodes of The Shamrock Shore, Ronald Reagan's 1984 speech to the Dáil Eireann, a 1984 Easter Rising commemoration, and other radio programs on Irish topics.
Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Gina Tlamsa were transferred to New York University in May 2007 by Gina Tlamsa. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Gina Tlamsa Papers; AIA 037; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Materials were rehoused in acid-free folders and boxes, with oversize paper materials separated into appropriate housing. Separation sheets were created for these items. Audiovisual material was rehoused in archival boxes and labeled with unique identifiers.
